title: José's Solo Sojourn in Curitiba, Brazil

objectsList.description: Given the mild temperatures in Curitiba, light clothing such as T-shirts will be most comfortable for daily wear.
To keep you comfortable during your sightseeing, choose comfortable footwear. Remember you asked for this specific brand.
For those cooler evenings or breezy days, it's a good idea to have a few pairs of long pants.
Perfect for warmer weather activities, shorts are a must-have for your trip.
Don't forget the important gift for your friend living in Curitiba!
A light jacket is good to keep off the chill during the cooler days.
Essential clothing items for every day of the trip.
Enough to last your trip and keep your feet dry and comfortable.
Prepare outfits for clubbing. Curitiba has a vibrant night scene you should enjoy.
You never know when you might want to take a dip. Include a swimsuit just in case!

requiredItems: a gift for a friend who lives in Curitiba
description:
Join José on his Solo Sojourn in Curitiba, Brazil. Curitiba, the capital of the southern Brazilian state of Paraná, is known for its innovative urban planning and for its vibrant cultural mix. During his solo journey, José is eagerly looking forward to immersing himself in the unique culture, rich history, and magnificent architecture the city has to offer. From eating out local cuisine, to sightseeing the beautiful parks and historical sites, and enjoying the vibrant nightlife, José is set to make the most of his solo Brazilian adventure!

This journey will be an unparalleled mix of relaxation, discovery, and adventure. Your suitcase will be packed to the brim with all the essentials for this thrilling trip, ensuring that you can focus on creating unforgettable memories. Let’s embark upon this beautiful journey and unleash the thrill-seeker in José.
tour: Botanical Garden of Curitiba - A breathtakingly beautiful garden featuring unique flora and fauna, a greenhouse, and a vast collection of national and international plants.
Oscar Niemeyer Museum - Learn about the modernist architecture of Brazil's beloved architect, Oscar Niemeyer.
Visit a traditional 'feira' - No trip to Brazil is complete without tasting regional culinary specialties at a traditional 'feira', or street market.
